intro: Mildbraedia paniculata subsp. occidentalis, commonly known as the western starburry, is a flowering plant native to western North America. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescence and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and open habitats, such as grasslands and forest edges. Its flowers are small and white, forming dense clusters that attract pollinators like bees and butterflies. The subspecies is distinguished by its slightly different leaf morphology and geographic distribution compared to other subspecies of Mildbraedia.
